page.title: 05FARMING IN BURNESTON AREA
page.content: Most of the farming in our area is crops such as barley and wheat. Sugar beet and oil-seed rape are also grown, while one farmer has planted peas for the first time. There are two dairy farms at Carthorpe, one of which grows maize as cattle food. The farm at Theakstone is a stud farm for horses. Mr.Barker at Burneston told us that he keeps sheep as well. He sends them to market at Bedale or Northallerton. There is one farm on the very edge of our area on the A1 where they keep pigs in big sheds.
